channel.title: R on Portio
channel.description: Recent content in R on Portio

item.title: TfL bike sharing
item.description: Excess rentals in TfL bike sharing In this project we will focus on the TfL Dataset. The goal is to better visualize the changes on the number of Bike hired. First lets look at the monthly changes compared to the 2016-2019 monthly average. general_monthly_average <- bike %>% filter(year>=2016 & year<=2019) %>% group_by(month) %>% summarise(general_monthly_average = mean(bikes_hired)) monthly_average <- bike %>% filter(year>=2016) %>% group_by(year, month) %>% summarise(monthly_average = mean(bikes_hired), year = unique(year)) full_monthly_averages <- left_join(monthly_average, general_monthly_average, by="month") full_monthly_averages %>% ggplot(aes(x=month, group=1)) + geom_line(aes(y=monthly_average)) + geom_line(aes(y=general_monthly_average), color = "blue", size=0.

item.title: Trump and COVID-19
item.description: What is the relationship between Trump and anti-Vax ? This project is based on this article: The Racial Factor: There’s 77 Counties Which Are Deep Blue But Also Low-Vaxx. Guess What They Have In Common? To get vaccination by county, we will use data from the CDC We will also need the County Presidential Election Returns 2000-2020 Finally, we also need an estimate of the population of each county PLot the relationship between Political views and Anti-Vax proportion.

item.title: Weather Anomalies
item.description: Climate change and temperature anomalies We want to study climate change, we can find data on the Combined Land-Surface Air and Sea-Surface Water Temperature Anomalies in the Northern Hemisphere at NASA’s Goddard Institute for Space Studies. The tabular data of temperature anomalies can be found here To define temperature anomalies, we need to have a reference, or base, period which NASA clearly states that it is the period between 1951-1980.
